intro: Calendula byzantina, commonly known as Byzantine marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Calendula byzantina is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
